results.title: The Young traveller in London
results.creator_credit: Egon Larsen, H Caspirius, INCA and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A young girl from the Scottish Highlands visits London for the first time, invited by her relatives. She expects to be shown round by them but discovers that they cannot agree on what to show her - for London means something different to them all; finally, as the film shows, she is taken on three separate trips.

results.title: The Young swimmer: the crawl stroke
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the fundamental principles pf the crawl stroke. A troop of championships swimmers demonstrates in turn the various aspects of the stroke - the attainment of balance by combined leg and arm movement; the correct leg action, observed from above, and below the water surface; breathing; arm action, the thumb entering the water first; co-ordinations of all movement; and the turn.

results.title: The Young person's guide to the orchestra
results.brief_description: This video focuses on the unique qualities of each instrument from it’s creation by the manufacturer to the musician who skilfully channels its sound. Narration by conductor Andrew Davis and interviews with world-acclaimed musicians, such as Yo-Yo Ma, provide insight and flavour to describe the instruments and their role in the sound of the orchestra. Suitable for Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: The Young directors
results.creator_credit: Peter Drummond and Beaumaris Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film looks at the way various young film makers in Australia are adapting film to communicate their ideas. A film about films, it mirrors the distinctive style of student films, cutting quickly, moving rapidly over a wide range of activities and places, contrasting different approaches to film study. Thirteen schools from five States were selected as being representative of filmmaking in Australian schools.

results.brief_description: A collection of very short films made by children, with technical advice from adults, from stories invented, drawn and commentated by the children.

results.title: The Year of the wildebeeste
results.brief_description: An extraordinary documentary of a herd on one million wildebeests on their annual epic two thousand mile migration in Kenya in search of grain and water during the dry summer months. Immense herd of antelope, zebra, giraffe and buffalo accompany them. Narrator: James Mason.

results.title: The Worlds of Rudyard Kipling
results.brief_description: The film uses over 600 still photographs to present Kipling- the poet, novelist, patriot and chauvinist- and his love of America, India and South Africa. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: The World tree: A scandinavian creation myth (K)_
results.brief_description: An art film which depicts the Scandinavian myth of Voluspa involving the opposing forces of fire and ice, the frost giant, the ice cows and the gods who created everything on Earth, including the world tree which formed a bridge between the gods and the universe they had created.
